citation.article-title: Fluviicola taffensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel freshwater bacterium of the family Cryomorphaceae in the phylum 'Bacteroidetes'.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Fluviicola [Flu.vi.i.co′la. L. masc. n. fluvius -ii river; L. suff. -cola (from L. masc. n. incola) inhabitant, dweller; N.L. masc. n. Fluviicola river dweller].
Non-flagellated, rod-shaped cells including rarer long filaments.
Cell mass is pigmented yellow–orange and flexirubins are synthesized.
Fatty acids contain a high proportion of branched-chain fatty acids (mainly i15 : 0 and i15 : 1ω10c), as well as significant amounts of hydroxy fatty acids (mainly 3-OH i17 : 0).
Isolated from freshwater environments, and do not grow in the presence of Na+ ions.
16S rRNA gene sequence analysis indicates that the genus is a member of the family Cryomorphaceae in the phylum ‘Bacteroidetes’.
The type species is Fluviicola taffensis.
